reviews.review_msg: Absolutely loved and enjoyed taking my first humanities course with Dr. Minard. While this is the only humanities course I'll ever take due to it not being my major, I still use what Antone has referenced to my current classes and conversations. His enthusiasm and witty comments in class had me engaged throughout the semester.

Do NOT take his class if you need a GPA Booster. Attendance isn't mandatory but has participation marks. A lot of reading, w/ quizzes every other week on lecture and readings, and 2 essays - harsh marker on essays, very opinionated & will pick on every sentence of your writing. Material is dry & all over the place so try your best to stay away!
He's amazing. That's all!

I took this class as an elective. The class was dry every single time. He just summarized books, what a certain theme meant. No class participation required in the lecture as he talks the whole way through with no break. He expects a lot from you for mediocre lectures and a disorganized syllabus and all papers had vague guidelines.

Doesn't seem like he cares about his students that much. Lectures aren't really mandatory. He just gives summaries of books you need to read, which may be good if you didn't read them (although you could just do the same online). Doesn't give the friendliest vibe but still an alright professor despite a bit of vulgarity here and there.

Not sure why Wayne is getting such negative reviews. I took him in 2016 spring (late comment) and we had 3 papers and a final. Lectures were dry but that's because I wasn't interested in the content. Wayne was witty and gave a lot of feedback! I put little to no effort into the course and still received a B+. Would definitely take again.

While I like Prof Knight's attitude I cannot say I enjoyed any part of his teaching style or class material. Lectures were beyond boring, and as a second year student, who has taken humanities classes before, I found a lot of his lectures irrelevant. Midterm  20 multiple choice. Final paper prompt was absurdly stupid. The TA was of no help.

Wayne is one of the most confusing prof I've ever taken. He is all over the place with his lecture. He can be talking one book and leads of to topics that just confuse the students even more. His voice is boring, makes the lecture really unbearable. He is very unclear with what he wants for the papers. No outline for a first year Writing course..

Really good professor. He is a tough marker, and will give  a lot of feedback  (maybe more than you asked for...). If you're looking for an easy A I wouldn't recommend, but if you really want to learn and have discussions, he's great.

Wayne is a good prof and he knows what he's talking about. The course is easy if you are willing to read the books and write a great paper. His feedback was really helpful, and his marking for the papers were very fair. Lectures were super boring though, tutorials are mandatory!

He understands the topic of what he is teaching but if you have a specific question he skirts around it and you end up more confused then before. Lectures feel very long, everything he says you can look up online. If you're a decent writer this class isn't hard. He even expressed that this semester had the highest class drop he's ever had.

Hes a really great prof. This was my favourite class. He was kind and patient when he answered my questions. Hes open-minded and does not judge you based on your perspectives. Although quietly spoken, his lectures are inspirational and eye-opening. I had a really great time enjoying his lectures, and I hope to see him again in future!

- I would highly recommend this class to anyone who likes to think about the big issues in society and life. The class was great largely because Wayne had his stuff well thought out and delivered some interesting insights while still allowing some discussion even in lecture. Doesn't hurt he is one of the funniest prof/ teacher I've had to date.

Nice guy and sweet to students. This is a writing course based on the philosophical class topics. He is a very harsh grader for the papers but gives A LOT of feedback which is handy. Didn't love the mandatory class discussions, I would always be chosen to talk about my posts. Very passionate about Asian studies so it's a big focus in class.

I had to satisfied by W requirement, and HUM101W was my only choice that fitted my schedule. I was extremely confused at first because I had no background in Humanities, but Paul was a great professor. You have to read a lot to understand, and it is writing intensive. However if you read enough, you will understand most things he teaches.

Professor Crowe is an amazing teacher. One of the best I have encountered. He is extremely devoted and spends time to ensure that the course is of the highest quality. He gives so much feedback even though it takes him forever because he cares. He is a genuine real teacher who gets you to think rather than memorize.

The class was easy and well-rounded for an entry-level humanities course teaches both traditional and modern philosophy. This class is safe to take because you can dive into any part of humanities you prefer in the essays. All three difficulty points are for the way he marks essays (sometimes he could have gone easier).

Do not take unless mandatory for your degree. Class is an introduction to humanities yet I've never been more confused in a humanities class before. The professor is inconsistent with his rubric and docks grades for criteria he fails to mention. Never shows up to class with prepared slides just stands and talks in the front for the duration.

Lectures were confusing and he rarely had slides ready for class. With the TSSU strike many concepts were skimmed over or skipped completely. Second paper ended up being worth 40% of the total grade and the grading rubric was changed mid semester without any guidance. Tough grader, unclear, unorganized and came to class unprepared.

Fairly interesting topics, good crossover between modern and ancient topics. Lots of reading, some pretty difficult to follow along with, but he is extremely fair and takes feedback seriously to improve the course. Flexible with deadlines if he sees that people are struggling. Overall good prof and enjoyed the course

Samir is a great person and cares about his students. However, unless this class is required for your major I would avoid it due to the work load. Average 2hrs of reading a week + 1hr homework (if you know what you're doing) on top of regular class time. Must participate in tutorials each class for marks. Not a GPA booster, concepts can be hard.

I am currently in his Hum 101W class & this is only our 3rd class and I feel a little lost. He makes great discussion in the class but I feel like he digress a lot and does not provide good lecture notes or guidelines for that matter. I'm a biology student & I'm used to clear notes. I wish he was more organized. Prepare to read 8 different textbook

Definitely knows his stuff...except he can't communicate well with his students. He mumbles in class so it's really hard to hear him. He treats it like a 4th year class too! He's very unorganized with last-minute slides full of typos and is a fickle. Be prepared to do lots of readings. Could've been way more interesting...

Professor Sofos was a kind and approachable prof who answered all my emails within 48hrs or less!The class itself was not very difficult as your grade is essentially based on two essays and the final.The problem I had was that we were assigned about 25 readings and some of them were quite long and for first year they were difficult to keep up with.

I took this course for the writing credit, and it was way more enjoyable than I thought it would be. He made the topic very enjoyable and was really easygoing and friendly to talk to. The grading criteria for all the assignments were very clear, and the study guide for the final exam was also very helpful. Overall, he was such a great professor!

Took this course as an elective and was one of the BEST profs I've had!! He was super nice and approachable. Always had an answer to all my questions. Super chill and considerate about assignment due dates. Courseload was moderate: 2 essays, a project and a final(exam guide was provided!). Would take this course again just to have him as my prof!

Adrian was great and a very kind professor; he was always very understanding and helpful. Quite a number of assignments but they aren't too hard, besides the analysis paper. However, the weekly readings for the course are super long (i'd recommend summarizing them). This was his first semester at SFU and he was my favourite prof this semester.

Christine Jones is a really helpful professor! I find that she did cover the material very quickly in lectures, but if you have her as your tutorial leader, she can cover things in great detail. I enjoyed this class and I highly recommend taking her classes.

Best Professor EVER, this class was an easy A, hes very informative and a great mind to talk to, i could listen to him talk for ages, the essays were easy and short and the final was straight memorization which he prepared us for, unfortunately hes leaving for Toronto so I wont be able to take another class with him :(
